lines.text: Maybe he's the person that he con'd the most. I mean we all do that, you know. We all keep a little bit of ourselves hidden. Cuz if we didn't, well, then we'd have to look at who we are. Who we really are. And if we didn't like it, well, we'd have nobody to blame but ourselves.
Prior use of the machine is not determinative of possessorary interest.
[both punch him at the same time]
I don't pose, I don't preen, I don't put perjured testimony on the stand. I don't make a mockery of the American legal system.
Well, you have your style, and I got mine.

My kindergarten teacher. I was four. She said I was too advanced for my class, and so they skipped a grade. I didn't want to be skipped, but everybody acted like I was so special. Then pretty soon I working even harder to get skipped all over again. And that, my friend, is how you end up in the junkyard.

[to Richard]
You know, you really missed your calling. You should have really been an actor.

[on motorcycle]
Oh yeah, ha ha! Oh! We should definitely slow down now, okay? No, don't go faster! Aaaah! Whoa, okay, whoa!
What am I supposed to hold on to?
Well I gotta hold on to something, it's dangerous.
